sense.name: counteract, prevent, weaken
sense.examples: How tax dollars undercut the environment. Morton has a penchant for pop art that tends to undercut the strength of his observations. U.S. inflation data undercut the dollar. We can undercut the tyrant by fueling a popular revolt. Apple undercut Dell's legendary low pricing with its Mac Pro.

sense.name: cut away at the underside of something
sense.examples: In 1897 a tunnel was driven to undercut an ore body exposed on the surface. A hole was targeted to undercut a quartz vein we exposed.

sense.name: SPORTS: strike (a ball) to give backspin or elevation
sense.examples: Stile delivered a swooping undercut sidespin ball that struck the table.
